Definition| How to become a pharmacist

Pharmacists are defined as a healthcare professional that specializes in the right way to use, store, preserve, and provide medicine. They as well guide on how to use medications, and also  They can guide you on how to use medications, and let you know about any potential adverse effects of what you take. They fill prescriptions issued by doctors and other healthcare professionals.

How to Become a Pharmacist: Steps to Take From High School

There are many ways for students interested in a career as a pharmacist, with practical planning, students can decrease their time spent in school as well as the cost and extra unnecessary classes and earn their white coast sooner rather than later.

 High School Subjects| How to become a pharmacist

Students should take class in the following subjects that will take to advance level

  • Biology
  • Physics
  • Mathematics

 Suggested Extracurricular STEM

To maintain the basic skill needed in becoming a pharmacist, students are advice to pursue STEM, healthcare, or communication.

Some thoughts of extracurricular might include: 

  • Science Olympiad
  • Debate team
  • School newspaper
  • Working in a nursing home
  • HOSA (Future Health Professionals, formerly Health Occupations Students of America).

College Requirements| How to become a pharmacist

Undergraduate + Graduate School Path—The fact that prerequisites vary by school but the commonly needed classes includes: 

  • General chemistry with lab (2 semesters)
  • Organic chemistry with lab (2 semesters)
  • Biochemistry
  • Biology with lab (2 semesters)
  • Microbiology with lab (1-2 semesters)
  • Physics with lab (2 semesters)
  • Human anatomy with lab
  • Physiology
  • Microbiology
  • Psychology (1-2 semesters)
  • Statistics
  • Calculus
  • Economics
  • English (2 semesters)

Duration to become a Pharmacist| How to become a pharmacist

The advantage of these programs is two-fold:

Students may not take the PCAT (pharmacy College Admission Test), and students get their pharmD on accelerate timeline. Students who have their undergraduate degree first will spent 8 years to get a pharmD (4 years undergraduate and 4years PharmD) and 6 in opposite to 6 years of a two degree program.

Average salary of pharmacists

Since pharmacists are valued and as well the huge amount of training they undergo they are well compensated about an average of $128,710 annually.
